awd_abstract_narration: Previous studies of micro-instabilities in a hot plasma have               generally employed the plasma dispersion function which is                      strictly applicable only to a Maxwilliam distribution.  Natural                 plasmas, however, contain a pronounced high energy component                    which can best be modeled a by Lorentzian distribution.  The                    stability properties of such a distribution can be substantially                different from that of a Maxwilliam plasma leading to dramatic                  changes in the growth or damping rate of plasma waves.  This                    grant is to evaluate explicitly the stability of a Lorentzian                   plasma and to investigate the path integrated gain of waves in a                fully hot plasma using a hot ray tracing code.  ***                                                                                                               //
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
